definition: to check/to examine/to inspect/to exercise restraint
short name for Chahar Province 察哈爾|察哈尔[Cha2 ha1 er3]
to examine/to inquire/to observe/to inspect/to look into/obvious/clearly evident
public prosecutor/public procurator (judicial officer whose job may involve both criminal investigation and public prosecution)

pinyin: Zui4 gao1 Ren2 min2 Jian3 cha2 yuan4

sentences.english: But the prosecutor declined on the grounds that the issue should be investigated in the US.
sentences.chinese: 但檢察官拒絕的理由是，這個案子應當在美國調查。

sentences.english: When a public security organ demands the arrest of an offender, it shall obtain the approval of a people's procuratorate.
sentences.chinese: 公安機關要求逮捕人犯的時候，由人民檢察院批准。

sentences.english: By the orders of the deputy procureur?
sentences.chinese: 是奉了代理檢察官的命令嗎？

sentences.english: Prosecutors said none of the suspects got any real secrets.
sentences.chinese: 檢察官稱嫌疑人沒有得到任何真正的祕密。

sentences.english: People's procuratorates at all levels may install judicial police as needed.
sentences.chinese: 各級人民檢察院根據需要可以設司法警察。

sentences.english: Now every country is different in application of public discretion, discretion power of public prosecution of proc.
sentences.chinese: 公訴裁量權是檢察機關的一項非常重要的權力。

sentences.english: Listen to me. The P.A. is going to want to know why you didn’t scream.
sentences.chinese: 聽我說，檢察官會問你爲什麼不喊叫。

sentences.english: The inspector was able to put his finger on the weak point in the suspect's alibi.
sentences.chinese: 檢察官能準確指出嫌疑人辯辭中的弱點。

sentences.english: The preliminary investigation system is an outcome of the proceeding practice of our prosecutorial organizations.
sentences.chinese: 初查制度是我國檢察機關訴訟實踐的產物。

sentences.english: In Great Britain, the Attorney General prosecutes for the Grown in certain cases.
sentences.chinese: 在英國，檢察總長在某些案件中代表王室進行公訴。

sentences.english: Prosecutors said Douglas had signed a plea agreement, but the details weren't disclosed.
sentences.chinese: 檢察官說他已簽了辯訴協議，但沒透露具體細節。

sentences.english: The people's procuratorates in China are state organs for legal supervision.
sentences.chinese: 人民檢察院是國家的法律監督機關。

sentences.english: And meanwhile, the Laws should regulated the supervising of the execution of the penalty of property.
sentences.chinese: 同時，法律應明確規定對財產刑執行的檢察監督。

sentences.english: In many countries, a state prosecutor can bring a criminal libel suit.
sentences.chinese: 在許多國家，政府檢察官可以提起刑事誹謗訴訟。

sentences.english: The public security organ or the people's procuratorate shall inform the prison of the result of its handling.
sentences.chinese: 公安機關或者人民檢察院應當將處理結果通知監獄。

sentences.english: Therefore, we should rebuild the system according to the target and the rule of the prosecutorial work.
sentences.chinese: 應按照檢察目標和檢察工作規律的要求進行重構。

definition: public prosecutor/public procurator (judicial officer whose job may involve both criminal investigation and public prosecution)
lack of discipline/to break a rule/to violate discipline/to breach a principle
Ma Ying-jeou (1950-), Taiwanese Kuomintang politician, Mayor of Taipei 1998-2006, president of Republic of China 2008-2016
to sue/to bring a lawsuit against/to prosecute
to hold accountable/to blame/to censure/to apportion blame
